Body: I think the notion of transformation still exists for most generative grammarians, although the use of the exact term transformation has fallen out of favor. One tends to break transformations down into their component procedures. One acknowledges mechanisms such as move or copy or merge to describe and explain how various grammatical structures are related to and derived from each other. The underlying idea remains the same, however, although the description of the transformations has become much more exact than it was in the early days of Transformational Grammar.
